noun.description: A distinct section of a piece of writing, usually dealing with a single theme and indicated by a new line, indentation, or numbering.
examples: the information set out in paragraph 3

verb.description: Arrange (a piece of writing) in paragraphs.
examples: his style deploys a lack of conventional paragraphing

origin: Late 15th century: from French paragraphe, via medieval Latin from Greek paragraphos short stroke marking a break in sense, from para- beside + graphein write.
